IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: EMPOWERING INDIVIDUALS WITH VISION LOSS TO ATTAIN INDEPENDENCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: EMPOWERING INDIVIDUALS WITH VISION LOSS TO ATTAIN INDEPENDENCE.
IRS990.Desc: ENTERPRISE GROUP - IN 2018, VISIONCORPS ENTERPRISE GROUP PROVIDED 106,408 HOURS OF WORK TO EMPLOYEES WHO ARE BLIND. VISIONCORPS MISSION TO PROVIDE THE TOOLS FOR GREATER INDEPENDENCE IS PARTIALLY ACHIEVED BY PROVIDING EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE WHO ARE BLIND IN BOTH THEIR MANUFACTURING AS WELL AS SERVICES DIVISIONS. THE NATIONAL UNEMPLOYMENT RATE FOR PEOPLE WHO ARE BLIND IS 70% WHICH IS WHY, AT VISIONCORPS, PEOPLE WHO ARE BLIND ARE FIRST CONSIDERED FOR EMPLOYMENT FOR POSITIONS WHICH THEY ARE ACADEMICALLY OR VOCATIONALLY ABLE TO PERFORM AT THE HIGHEST STANDARDS. NO LESS THAN 75% OF DIRECT LABOR PERFORMED AT VISIONCORPS IS DONE BY EMPLOYEES WHO ARE BLIND. PROVIDING MEANINGFUL, WELL COMPENSATED EMPLOYMENT FOR PEOPLE WHO ARE BLIND IS A TOP PRIORITY AT VISIONCORPS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: REHABILITATION SERVICES - IN 2018, VISIONCORPS REHABILITATION SERVICES DEPARTMENT UNDERWENT CHANGES TO BETTER SERVE ITS GROWING CLIENT BASE. STATISTICS INDICATE THAT IN THE NEXT DECADE, THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE WHO ARE BLIND IN THE US WILL DOUBLE. VISIONCORPS PARTICIPATES WITH MEDICARE BY USING AN OCCUPATIONAL THERAPIST. OVERALL, VISIONCORPS SERVED 1,187 UNIQUE CLIENTS IN ITS MANY SERVICE AREAS, FOR A TOTAL OF 11,348 SERVICE HOURS. PREVENTATIVE SERVICES WERE ALSO PERFORMED, RESULTING IN THE SCREENING AND EDUCATION OF MORE THAN 8,441 INDIVIDUALS, BOTH CHILDREN AND ADULTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: YOUTH SERVICES - IN A CONTINUED EFFORT TO PROVIDE THE MOST EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT SERVICES TO THEIR YOUNGEST CLIENTS, THE YOUTH PROGRAM PROVIDES FOCUSED ACTIVITIES FOR ALL STAGES OF DEVELOPMENT, WHILE ALSO OFFERING MORE AVENUES FOR INDEPENDENCE FOR CHILDREN AS THEY GROW AND TRANSITION TO VISIONCORPS ADULT SERVICES PROGRAM. ACTIVITES ALSO INCLUDE PARTICIPATION OF ALL FAMILY MEMBERS, AND SUPPORT FROM COMMUNITY PROFESSIONALS AND BUSINESSES. THIS FOCUS WAS IN RESPONSE TO THE RECOGNIZED CHANGING NEEDS OF VISIONCORPS YOUNGEST CLIENTS. IN 2018, 94 UNIQUE CHILDREN AND FAMILIES WERE PROVIDED WITH REHABILITATION SERVICE, FOR A TOTAL OF 3,395 HOURS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INVESTMENT POLICIES ARE DESIGNED TO PRESERVE THE PRINCIPAL OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS. A PORTION OF EARNINGS IS AVAILABLE FOR OPERATIONS, AND A PORTION IS AVAILABLE FOR TRAINING PURPOSES.

THE ORGANIZATION IS NOT AWARE OF ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME THAT WOULD BE SUBJECT TO TAXATION. ACCORDINGLY, THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE FORM 990-T WILL NOT BE FILED. THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS THE PROVISIONS OF ASC TOPIC 740, INCOME TAXES, AND IS NOT AWARE OF ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS, AND ACCORDINGLY, NO CORRESPONDING LIABILITY, INCLUDING PENALTIES AND INTEREST, HAS BEEN RECORDED IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 9,781,959. CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTERESTS 77,381.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: CASH GRANTS ARE FOR SPECIALIZED EYE TESTING

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: VOUCHERS FOR SERVICES ARE GIVEN TO INDIVIDUALS. INDIVIDUAL GOES FOR SERVICE AT THEIR PROVIDER AND SUBMITS THE VOUCHER AS PAYMENT FOR THE SERVICE. PROVIDER IN TURN SUBMITS VOUCHER TO VISIONCORPS WHO PAYS THE PROVIDER.
DENNIS STEINER - $10,000 JODIE REINHART - $2,000 SHELLEY SANDERS - $3,000

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ZACH KLIPA (MEMBER) HAS A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP WITH STEVE KLIPA (MEMBER).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANT AND SUBMITTED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW AND DISCUSSION AND TO MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION ASKS EACH MEMBER OF MANAGEMENT AND MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO COMPLETE AN ANNUAL SURVEY, DISCLOSING OTHER BUSINESS RELATIONSHIPS AND INTERESTS AND ACCEPTANCE OF PROHIBITED GIFTS. ANY CONFLICTS DISCLOSED IN THESE SURVEYS ARE REPORTED TO THE CEO, WHO THEN REPORTS TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD. THE CEO AND EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE INVESTIGATE APPARENT CONFLICTS, AND DETERMINE THE PROPER COURSE OF ACTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION PARTICIPATES IN A SALARY AND BENEFITS SURVEY OF NIB AFFILIATED ORGANIZATIONS AND ALSO USES FORMS 990 AVAILABLE ON GUIDESTAR TO DEVELOP AN AVERAGE SALARY / BENEFIT LEVEL FOR SIMILAR POSITIONS IN SIMILAR NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO SUBSCRIBES TO PAYSCALE.COM FOR PAY DATA ASSOCIATED WITH ALL WAGE INCREASES AND INCENTIVES. RECOMMENDATIONS FOR PAY INCREASES, INCENTIVES, AND EXECUTIVE PENSION CONTRIBUTIONS ARE THEN DEVELOPED BY MANAGEMENT, AND ARE PRESENTED BY THE CEO TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD, WHICH MAKES DECISIONS REGARDING THESE MATTERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICIES ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
DONATED SERVICES EXPENSE -18,000. CHANGE IN BENEFICIAL INTERESTS 77,381.

THE FINANCE COMMITTEE ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE AUDIT OF THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND THE SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT CERTIFIED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED DURING THE CURRENT YEAR.

FOR THE FISCAL YEAR BEING REPORTED, DIRECT LABOR WAGES AND BENEFITS WERE NOT CHARGED TO COST OF GOODS SOLD, BUT INSTEAD WERE INCLUDED IN PROGRAM SERVICES FUNCTIONAL EXPENSES IN PART IX, COLUMN B, LINES 7, 8, 9, AND 10. THESE AMOUNTS ARE BEING REPORTED IN THIS MANNER SINCE EMPLOYMENT OF THE BLIND IS PART OF THE ASSOCIATION'S MISSION. THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF DIRECT LABOR WAGES AND BENEFITS THAT WAS REPORTED IN THE FUNCTIONAL EXPENSES WAS $2,998,562.

IdRelatedTaxExemptOrgGrp.PrimaryActivitiesTxt: SUPPORT THE INITIATIVES AND PROGRAMS SERVING THE BLIND AND VISION IMPAIRED
